body.p:
Maysville Ky, Augt 26. 1863.
To his Excellency,
The Governor of Kentucky
Sir:

On the 13th of last June, Edward Fleming, of our City, a very poor man, and so crippled as to disable him (physically) to maintain his family, which is quite large, was fined by our Mayor $20 & costs, for selling a drink of liquor.
Under all the circumstances of the case, we respectfully ask your Excellency to remit the fine; feeling that you would be doing justice to his wife and children.

C. B. Anderson,
Wm C Jenkins
Ryan and Batty
H. Ryan
W. F. Wilson
R. G. January
Lewis Desson
H Bertram
James Shackleford
H. Taylor
Ross & Newell
Saml W. Owens

Pet for Remission of fine $20 for retailing
